title.narrative: 205 EDUCATION

description.narrative: COs and partners are supported by ROSA to accelerate the reduction and prevention of out-of-school girls and boys and improve learning outcomes from early childhood to adolescence., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas (Covid), Skills Development, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Comprehensive, sustainable and enabling environment that leaves no child behind is supported by policies, programmes, strategies, budgets and actions of Governments, regional institutions, private sector, media, financial institutions, UN and UNICEF country programmes in South Asia, in development and humanitarian contexts.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: COs and partners are supported by ROSA to accelerate the reduction and prevention of out-of-school girls and boys and improvelearning outcomes from early childhood to adolescence.

description.narrative: Through cross-sectoral work focused on ECE/D, basic education, adolescent skills and partnerships, ROSA is supporting Governments to reduce OOSC numbers, decrease gender disparities and inequities, raise learning levels, and enhance school safety, quality and inclusiveness. ROSA continues to support COs and Governments in the COVID-19 response to mitigate its impact on education, through technical assistance in: monitoring and improving the reach and effectiveness of remote learning, national strategies on digital and blended learning and addressing the digital divide, learning recovery including assessment and remediation, sustained safe reopening of schools, advancing health promoting schools, and building back better through re-imagining education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
